thread.title: Agency orders SeaPort Airline to continue service in Tupelo
thread.title_full: Agency orders SeaPort Airline to continue service in Tupelo - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Agency orders SeaPort Airline to continue service in Tupelo
text:
TUPELO, Miss. (AP) - The U.S. Department of Transportation has denied SeaPort Airlines' request to end service in Tupelo and Muscle Shoals, Alabama by mid-November.
The Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal reports ( http://bit.ly/1Mqy0KS ) the department ordered the airline to continue service through at least Dec. 28.
Meanwhile, the agency is accepting bids to provide air service in the two communities through Oct. 28.
On Aug. 27, SeaPort Airlines asked the department to discontinue service in Tupelo no later than Nov. 13.
SeaPort, which has been criticized by the Tupelo Airport Authority for its poor performance, is being subsidized $2.5 million a year through the Essential Air Service program.
SeaPort said it was unable to provide service any longer because of the Federal Aviation Administration's new flight and duty limitations.
Information from: Northeast Mississippi Daily Journal, http://djournal.com
